headline: Goldman Sachs Governance Shift Drops DEI Criteria As Valuation Stays Premium
summary: Goldman Sachs Group (NYSE:GS) has removed formal Diversity, Equity and Inclusion criteria from its board director selection policy. The change brings Goldman Sachs in line with similar policy updates at other large US banks. The revised approach focuses on broader director qualifications without explicit DEI thresholds. For you as an investor, this is a governance story at one of the largest US investment banks, active in global markets, advisory, and asset and wealth management. The shift...
